text:
SECTION: 2014 Runner Up (S2) Question 3 Assumption
CONTEXT: Optimizing school lunches (Linear Optimization).
CONTENT: The **linear optimization model** assumes that **all nutritional requirements can be met simultaneously** and that there is a **perfect substitution** between different food sources (e.g., all sources of protein are equally effective).

SECTION: 2014 Champion (S1) Question 1 Model
CONTEXT: Daily caloric burn.
CONTENT: An Integral Calculus model was used. The metabolic rate R(t) was integrated over a 24-hour period (integral from 0 to 24) to calculate total calories burned, accounting for variations in activity levels throughout the day.

SECTION: 2014 Runner Up (S2) Question 3 Model
CONTEXT: Optimizing school lunches.
CONTENT: Constrained Linear Optimization was used. The objective was to maximize calories subject to constraints on budget ($7/week) and USDA nutritional guidelines (sodium, grains limits).
